intro: Swainsona bracteata, commonly known as the velvetleaf swainsona, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces long, slender pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Swainsona bracteata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, open environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
